runs.comm: and he starts with an outswinger that is too wide outside off
short of a length, wide. Guptill misses out. Plays with a vertical bat
full outside off, finally he gets closer to the off, but not close enough to make Guptill play
short of a length, at the stumps, defended to leg
wide half-volley, and Guptill lays into it with a big cover-drive
thick outside edge to a length ball. Rolls past fourth slip. There is no third man. They get three
full and wide, squeezed out to third man for one
doesn't seem like McCullum want to play after supper. First ball from Broad and he has cut it for six. The first of the match. Just fast hands  slight swivel to make room. And over point he goes
big drive this time but straight to point
gives him the charge, makes room too, Broad follows him, beats the inside edge
gives him the charge again, and this time he has hit this length ball clean out of the crews. Over mid-on she goes. We might not have a supper break today

incredible shot. Short of a length, just outside off, and he has somehow managed to punch it for almost a six. Great wrists and hands. The front leg goes away to make that little bit of room and he goes over point
you go short, I hit you. You go full, I hit you. Broad overpitches, he makes room, and he goes over cover. This is a great exhibition of domination
short of a length, punched to cover. Played according to the merit of the ball. Boring
short of a length, wide, cut away one bounce to third man
jumps out of the crease, takes this from middle and leg, and drives it cover cover-point for four. Exceptional batting
stays in the crease this time and again drives a full ball over point. Four more. Records alert please. Fastest fifty. Fastest hundred. Nothing is safe
charges again, nearly yorks himself, but still nearly gets four. Can't beat Taylor at point, though
and he is farming the strike now. Takes a single last ball

Finn to disappear. And there is a man in orange who has caught it one-handed. Baz is not plundering it all alone, he is sharing it around. Down the wicket, over extra cover. Easy as. Turns out the crowd catch is not clean, but Robin Hood McCullum gave you the chance, mate
bouncer, cramps him up, but doesn't matter to Baz. He ramps him over the keeper's head for four
another short ball. This time he cramps him up successfully and draws a dot
cramps him up all right but this time McCullum goes leg side. Pulls it for four to enter the 40s
Six six. This is carnage. Gentle length ball. Makes room and goes inside out over mid-off. Nearly hits a sponsors' car
down the wicket this time, Finn pulls the length back, and beats his swat at it
come on Guppers. Take a single. Don't just play straight to square leg
short of a length, outside off, defended to mid-off. Get a move on, Guppers
and he does get a move on. Length ball, angling in, and he whips it away through midwicket for four
wide down the leg side
on the pads, and they concede four leg-byes. Don;t do too much of that. That ruins McCullum's shot at the fastest hundred
short of a length, outside off, left alone
that's the worst possible result from the last ball of the over. Thick outside edge to third man for one
lovely shot by Guptill. His trademark flick-pull. This is just short of a length, he gets inside the line, and sends it crashing to the square-leg boundary
length ball, moves in, he drops it wide of mid-on for a single

he needs just one. Baz has broken his own record for the fastest fifty in a WC match. Short from Finn, not much room, but he has sent him sailing it over point for six. Third-fastest overall, and the fastest in WC. He has hit the sponsor's car. That might be the one that Southee gets at the end of the match
watch out that fastest hundred. McCullum is flying towards you. Down the wicket, makes room, smashes this shortish ball over cover for another six
full ball, on off, effortlessly drops it over long-off for six. This is destruction. McCullum needs six more such hits to beat ABD's record for the fastest hundred
another six. He is 72 off 21. This over has been 4,1, 6, 6, 6, 6. This is full again, and McCullum clears the front leg and hits him for a flat six back over his head. This is delightful domination
full, on off, defended to mid-off
pushed to point. That's two of the six dots Baz needs
Guptill can't help it when they follow his pads. Three leg-byes. Odds are getting longer now on Mac's hundred
slower ball gone wrong, he takes the full toss from the pads and slugs it away for four through midwicket
wide down the leg side
slower ball, draws a mis-hit from McCullum. Goes to short fine leg
long-off is back, and McCullum takes a single to retain strike. Pretty sure we are entering the last over of the match now

has he bottom-edged this full toss onto the stumps? He gives him the charge, Woakes bowls a high full toss, which McCullum tries to hit into the off side, and misses and it hits the top of the stumps. McCullum waits to see if this is over waist high, but the replays show it isn't. Lovely innings comes to an end. What joy to watch him captain and bat. Misses out on the fastest ODI hundred and fifty, but has broken his own record for the fastest fifty in a World Cup match
full and straight, and he defends to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, Williamson is on his toes to defend
angling into the pads, defended to midwicket
half-volley, middle and leg, driven down the ground, straight of mid-on, gets four in his own way
length ball, outside off, moves across to play this to gully
Guppers is thinking along the same lines. Slogs at one length ball, gets a thick inside edge for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
wide length ball, driven straight to point
come on Kane. What is this? Playing the ball according to its merit. Leaves this outswinger alone
full outside off, pushed straight to mid-off. This is dour stuff from KW
short and wide, he covers the line of the ball, and punches it square of third man for two
length ball, on off, pretty decent delivery, pushed to mid-off
solid front-foot defensive as Woakes stays on a length and just outside off

bowled'im. England need eight more such deliveries. They have discussed a miracle theory during the break. Guptill stays back to a length ball, which skids through to burst through his defence and knock the stumps back
on a length, outside off, defensive shot from Taylor
there won't be a maiden, Taylor plants the front foot across and plays around the front pad to clip this through midwicket for four
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
angling into the pads, Williamson lets it come on and places it wide of midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, Willaimson moves across to defend
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg for a single
short of a length, wide, he crunches it but can't beat the diving Taylor at point
lovely delivery. On a length, outside off, seaming away against the angle. Beats his drive
stays on a length and just outside off. Left alone
solid front-foot defensive to a length ball outside off
solid front-foot defensive again. Kane, there are times when you play Test cricket. This is not one of them
punched off the back foot, straight to mid-off
stop the press. England have bowled a maiden. Good bowling actually from Woakes. On a length, shaping away from just outside off. Williamson respects that and defends it
a soft top edge on the pull but it falls safe. Square leg is back and this falls next to the leg umpire
on a length, outside off, he moves across and defends
and Broad brings the end when the batsmen have been reluctant to. He bowls a bouncer that is too short, and sails over the keeper's head
